com.github.katjahahn.sections

Class SectionLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.katjahahn.sections.SectionLoader

  • public class SectionLoader
extends java.lang.Object
    Responsible for computing section related values and loading sections with the given section header information. The section loader is able to load special sections like the ImportSection, ExportSection and ResourceSection

    • Method Detail

      • loadSection

        public PESection loadSection(java.lang.String name)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Loads the section with the given name. If the file doesn't have a section by this name, it returns null. This does not instantiate subclasses of PESection. Use methods like loadImportSection() or loadResourceSection() instead. The file on disk is read to fetch the information
        Parameters:
        name - the section's name
        Returns:
        PESection of the given name, null if section isn't contained in file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if unable to read the file

      • loadSection

        public PESection loadSection(int sectionNr)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Loads the section with the given number and may patch the size of the section if the patchSize parameter is set. If the file doesn't have a section by this number, it returns null. This does not instantiate subclasses of PESection. Use methods like loadImportSection() or loadResourceSection() instead. The file on disk is read to fetch the information
        Parameters:
        sectionNr - the section's name
        Returns:
        PESection of the given number, null if there is no section with that number
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if unable to read the file

        Returns the bytes of the section with the specified number.
        Parameters:
        sectionNr - the number of the section
        Returns:
        bytes that represent the section with the given section number
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

        Returns the section entry of the section table the rva is pointing into.

        rva - the relative virtual address
        Returns:
        the SectionHeader of the section the rva is pointing into

      • loadImportSection

        public ImportSection loadImportSection()
                                throws java.io.IOException,
                                       FileFormatException
        Loads all bytes and information of the import section. The file on disk is read to fetch the information.
        Returns:
        the import section, null if not datadir entry for import table exists
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if unable to read the file
        FileFormatException - if import section can not be loaded

      • loadExportSection

        public ExportSection loadExportSection()
                                throws java.io.IOException
        Loads all bytes and information of the export section. The file on disk is read to fetch the information.

        the export section, null if file doesn't have an export section
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if unable to read the file

      • readDataDirBytesFor

        public byte[] readDataDirBytesFor(DataDirectoryKey dataDirKey)
                           throws java.io.IOException,
                                  FileFormatException
        Reads and returns the bytes that belong to the given data directory entry. The data directory entry rva points into section. This section is determined and the file offset for the rva calculated. This file offset is different from the beginning of the determined section, as the section may contain more than the data directory. The returned bytes start at that file offset and end at the end of the section the data directory is in.
        Parameters:
        dataDirKey - the key of the data directory entry you want the bytes for
        Returns:
        byte array that contains the bytes the data directory entry rva is pointing to
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if unable to read the file
        FileFormatException - if unable to load the file, e.g. not virtual address given
